labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed specifically to enhance the quality and effectiveness of coding-related prompts. Its sole available tool, "rewrite_coding_prompt," suggests that it focuses on refining coding prompts to produce better AI responses for coding tasks. This implies a specialized focus on software development workflows, particularly in the context of AI assistance.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of this server revolves around coding prompt optimization, which directly supports developers in crafting better instructions for AI coding assistants. While it could be considered under broader categories like Development Tools or AI/ML Tools, its specialization in coding prompt rewriting makes it more unique. Therefore, custom labeling would be most appropriate to capture this specific capability.

server_info_crawled.overview: Stop writing crappy Cursor AI prompts. Use a coding prompt engineer to rewrite your coding prompts and get the most out of your coding tasks.

tools.description: Deploy Server Coding Prompt Engineer @hireshBrem/prompt-engineer-mcp-server Try in Playground rewrite_coding_prompt

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@hireshBrem/prompt-engineer-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: anthropicApiKey
